# Welcome
***

I am a social scientist (PhD. Sociology, University of Helsinki, Finland) specialized in the domestic impact of international courts, public interest litigation, and human rights protection in Russia.

In my past research I examined litigation before the European Court of Human Rights on behalf of victims from the violent conflicts in Chechnya. At present I study how Russian human rights lawyers represent victims before court when judgments are manipulated and human rights law is discredited by politicians. How do these lawyers manage to protect a group of victims of the new wave of curtailing legislation: journalists at risk, citizens accused of treason, and NGOs that resist the foreign agent law? 

This project is funded by [the Kone Foundation] (http://www.koneensaatio.fi/en/), Finland (until March 2016) and the [Swedish Cultural Foundation] (http://www.kulturfonden.fi/) (until March 2017). In previous years my work has been funded by the Dutch VSBfonds, the Hendrik Muller Foundation, the Finnish Center for International Mobility, Nuffic, and mobility grants from the Academy of Finland. 

I currently work as a postdoctoral research fellow (funded by the Swedish Cultural Foundation) at the [Liu Institute for Global Issues] (http://liu.arts.ubc.ca/), University of British Columbia, Canada. Previously, I worked for the [Aleksanteri Institute for Russian and East European Studies] (http://www.helsinki.fi/aleksanteri/english/) at the University of Helsinki, Finland.

### Peer-reviewed articles

Van der Vet, Freek. Forthcoming. "In the Shadow of the Ombudsman: Civil Society and the Struggle for an Independent Human Rights Institution in St. Petersburg, Russia", _Europe-Asia Studies_

[Van der Vet, Freek and Lyytikäinen, Laura. 2015. "Violence and Human Rights in Russia: How Human Rights Defenders Develop their Tactics in the Face of Danger, 2005-2013". Special Issue "Critical Perspectives on the Security and Protection of Human Rights Defenders" _The International Journal of Human Rights_ 19 (7): 979-998](http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/13642987.2015.1075306)

Our special issue was endorsed by the United Nations Special Rapporteur on the Situation of Human Rights Defenders:

> "In the face of growing attacks on human rights in many countries, the risks faced by people who defend their universality have intensified. Human rights defenders increasingly face criminalization, persecution, arbitrary arrest and detention. They are threatened, physically attacked and assassinated. As we mark the 17th anniversary of the UN Declaration on Human Rights Defenders we should ask ourselves what more must be done to better protect defenders and promote their work. I welcome this Special Issue of the International Journal of Human Rights. It compels us to confront these challenges and to discuss critical questions, both among scholars and practitioners. Our next common goal is to translate this research into practical tools to strengthen the protection regime for human rights defenders", _Michel Forst, UN Special Rapporteur on the Situation of Human Rights Defenders_
